thread.title: Louisa Lytton says Lee Ryan wants her to return to EastEnders as his character Woody's girlfriend
thread.title_full: Louisa Lytton says Lee Ryan wants her to return to EastEnders as his character Woody's girlfriend

author: Jennifer Crothers
title: Louisa Lytton says Lee Ryan wants her to return to EastEnders as his character Woody's girlfriend
text:
Louisa Lytton says Lee Ryan wants her to return to EastEnders as his character Woody's girlfriend The actress is pals with new EastEnders star, Blue singer Lee Ryan Share Could Louisa be returning to The Square as Lee Ryan's love interest? Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Former EastEnders star Louisa Lytton could be returning to Albert Square - as Lee Ryan’s new character “Woody” Woodward’s love interest. 
Well, if Lee has his way, that is! 
Lee’s casting in the soap as heartbreaker Woody was announced last week, much to the delight of many fans of the Blue singer, and on Sunday Brunch, pal Louisa was asked if she could be in the frame for a comeback. 
Louisa - who played Ruby Allen in EastEnders - explained: “Lee texted me a year ago and I said the role would be good for him. Louisa has hinted she could return to the soap (Photo: Getty) Louisa Lytton was in the soap until 2006 (Photo: BBC) Lee Ryan will play 'Woody' Woodward in the soap (Photo: BBC) Louisa Lytton as Ruby Allen in the soap Read More As Lee Ryan joins EastEnders, which other famous faces have made the move to soapland? 
“Recently, he did say, ‘Maybe they should bring your character back as my girlfriend.'" 
The only stumbling block would be her ten-year absence from the show, which Louisa isn’t sure how the writers would explain. 
Earlier this month she told Lorraine that a comeback wouldn’t be off the cards, as she was still breathing on her exit from the soap. 
“I’m not dead, I left in the back of a taxi”, she pointed out. “I could go back, but here are no family members so that could be an issue.” 
Meanwhile, Lee said last week: "Woody is the best role I could have wished to play," he said. "He’s a brilliant character, and it’s clear he’s been leading a full and colourful life. I can’t wait for people to see what he’s like for themselves. 
"Everyone at EastEnders has been so welcoming. I know some of the cast already so I’m sure we’re going to have a lot of fun." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
